texts.text: Halt!
Good day, I'm looking for a friend. She is escorted by two groboclones.
Sorry, I didn't see them but try going to the astronomer's house in the Old Burg; he knows a lot about what is going on.
It is forbidden to talk about that!
If you want to see my cousin, go in front of the sink and wash your hands! Ha ha!
I was arrested for sneezing in public, it's ridiculous! There's also, however, a forger in the cell to the right of general headquarters.

I can't help you. Except perhaps... considering the risks you've taken, I guess I can trust you. I was arrested on this island, but earlier on I gave a fake red card to my brother who was living on Proxima island. He will give it to you if you say "Amos" to him (the location of the house is now indicated on your Holomap).
Dr. FUNFROCK's headquarters. Access IS FORBIDDEN!
Young male quetch seeks young female rabbibunny for friendship (and maybe more...)
Bah! Not interested.
As I live and breathe, you will never see me drink any tap water in this city, mate. And all you have to do is drink some of it to understand why!
That old pirate is right, the tap water tastes funny. They should be able to improve its quality, and by the way the water tower is located in the North mountains (check your holomap).
The Legend is a weak spot in FunFrock's power. You must discover why; it's the only way of seeing your friend again.
Good day, this talk about the Legend is strange, don't you think?
ANNOUNCEMENT #358-G : A prisoner named Twinsen has escaped from the Citadel. Anyone seeing the escapee must notify the nearest clone.
Opening hours for the Principal Island library: @ More or less, all the time.
We have some documents on the "Legend" somewhere in the Censored Publications Department, but you need special authorization to look at them. Let me see your ID card.
Good day. You need a boarding ticket to go to Citadel Island.

My dear and respected Dr. FunFrock, I took the plans of the Teleportation Center home with me, to work on them over the week-end. I will bring them back on Monday. Signed: Mies Van der Rooh, Architect, Bug Street, Citadel Island.
I'm interested in the story of LeBorgne the pirate.
I'm looking for the plans of the Teleportation Center. I'm on a special assignment!
Sound the alarm! It's the escapee!
Good day
A ferry ticket costs 10 kashes. However as I have a WANTED poster in my office, you will have to pay 30 Kashes to make me overlook the fact that you look a lot like the guy on it.
Halt! You are a wanted escapee!
If you give me 10 Kashes I'll let you read the poster behind me.
I saw them a little while ago on Citadel Island. But they left on a fast boat. Destination unknown!
Welcome, dear customer! I don't have any more cherry flavored syrup, but there is a pharmacy open on Citadel Island. @P Move in front of the item that interests you and use the ACTION command.
Mister, Mister! There's a loose stone in the back wall. I might be able to escape!
A loose stone? Let me see that.
The passage will only open when you come from my cousin's house. Now stop rummaging everywhere!
Sorry, but you don't have enough Kashes. Come back later.
Here you can't just talk to just anybody. Prove that you are not working for FunFrock. Go clobber a clone for starters!
Didn't see anything, but if you have any problems, you should talk to the Astronomer who is under house arrest, up above the Old Burg.
So you're the one that beats up on clones? Good job! I haven't seen your friend but you should go see the Astronomer. He will certainly be able to help you.
Leave me alone, this job is already hard enough.

This young girl must be someone important if that tyrant FunFrock is holding her outside of Citadel Island. Something funny is going on with this forbidding of any talk about the Legend: this must be some kind of weakness in his power! Find out what is behind this Legend, it's your only hope of seeing your friend again. If you need to leave the island, I know a friend who can help you at Port-Belooga (check your holomap). Tell him that I sent you. And be discreet in your quest.
Unfortunately, I don't know anything about the Legend, but I have a fisherman friend who could help you in your travels if you tell him that I sent you. He lives at Port-Belooga (check your holomap).
Ha ha! It's a colleague, he's looking for a wife.
I don't know anything about it, and anyway, it's a forbidden subject.

According to my doctor, I can drink only the city's tap water. But it tastes too bad. If someone could improve its taste, I would be willing to show him the Censored Publication Department, and that would be quite a privilege.
Hold on a minute, I'm going to taste the water.
Hmmmmm, cherry flavor, not bad... but I would have preferred carrot. But anyway, as promised, I will show you where the documents about the "Legend" are.
Never saw 'em! The sea is my only concern. @ Sometimes I even take voyagers on my boat, but only people that I can trust.
If the Astronomer sent you, I guess I can trust you. Despite the solidarity in the resistance against FunFrock, you know, times are hard. For 10 Kashes I'll take you where you want to go.
I don't know yet.
To the White Leaf Desert.
I'm not going to leave just yet.
You don't have enough Kashes to make the trip Twinsen. See you later!

In the distant past, when the spheros, rabbibunnies, Quetches and grobos emerged from the original primordial soup, centuries before Dr. FunFrock's coup, a prophecy was pronounced. Its text is hardly remembered today and that is why people now refer to it as the "Legend". It explained how "the Heir," when his time had come, would be called to overthrow a tyrant! The secret of the Legend can still be learned somewhere in the White Leaf Desert.
You've just got back all the objects that were in your inventory!
You can come aboard sir, we were just getting underway.
Welcome to Principal Island.
I didn't see her, but I think that I can trust you now. Follow me, I know how to get to the Astronomer's home.
My cousin is a locksmith. He will open the unguarded door for you. Follow me!
I don't know if I can help you. I am a locksmith and I can open doors... but only for people that I can trust!
If you already know about that passage, I can open the unguarded door for you. After you!
I can help you get rid of the Supergro. Follow me, but wait until he moves away from the steps before going by!
Thief! @ Leave my money box alone!
You are too aggressive! Get out of here, and don't come back until you have calmed down!
Shut up stupid, it is forbidden to talk about it!
Principal island sanitation department: NO SWIMMING!
Where do you want to go?
To Port-Belooga.
To the water tower.
I'm paying to see!
No way, this smells like a scam!

I can guide you through the Censored Publications Department. There is one book that talks about the Legend. I could show it to you, but first, I would like you to change the taste of the tap water, here in the city. It is the only type of water that I am allowed to drink, and it is really disgusting.
Old Burg @ (Principal island)
Peg Leg Street @ (Principal island)
Sorry, but you don't have enough Kashes. Come back later.
To Proxima Island.
I read some of the Captain's log - LeBorgne was ruthless! If you are still interested, the log is on sale at the Old Burg bazaar, on this island.
I am Bob Vortix, astronomer under house arrest. What are you doing in town, apart from beating up clones?
The Astronomer sent me.
Come back when you know where you want to go.
Life candy: would you like 10 hearts for 10 Kashes?
Ok, I'll buy.
No, thank you.
Not enough Kashes!
Good day. Come this way, I'll open the door for you.
Sound the alarm! A prisoner is escaping!
My poor friend! I really don't know what you are talking about.

You know Julia? She is a nice girl. She watches a bit too much TV, but there is some truth in her story: someone left a box for clover leaves on the islet in front of my house. It is too shallow for a boat to get there by water, and since the bridge leading to the islet has collapsed, the only way to get there is to fly.
Very good sir, wait here please.
What are you doing there, who are you?
I'm fixing the antennas.
Twinsen, I'm escaping.
Santa Claus.
Welcome to Port-Belooga @ (Principal Island) @ Sea calm to choppy, gusty winds.
I'm not interested.
I'll buy.
Good day
L.B.A. @ Old Burg Sewer service. Emerald Moon Street.
Feel free to look through my stuff, creep!
She's not here. I would have noticed her. We don't have many readers these days.
I've been all over the island today, and I haven't seen those people.
I didn't see her.
I didn't see her.
Sorry. I haven't seen your trio.
I didn't see her, but ...
The water is drinkable, but it is true that it tastes funny. You'll have to go to the water tower if you want to change something.
Good day
Good day, mate.
Bye, say hi to my cousin when you see him.
Good day
Sorry, but you don't have enough Kashes. Come back later.
We don't trust people easily here. Prove that you don't work for FunFrock, clobber a clone!
To Citadel Island.
To Rebellion Island.
Here it is: like new, good handling and fast, this catamaran is for you!... for 200 Kashes.
Too expensive for my blood!
Great, I'll take it.
Not enough Kashes!

I've got to tell you something. It's awful! My best friend (Beatrice) is in love with Steven. But Paul, Steven's half brother, left Cindy when Linda got out of the clinic after her bobsleigh accident. But not for Linda, for Tatjana! Only Serge (who secretly admires Steven) has been trying for months to win the love of Tatjana who refuses to talk to Christy since she died. All the while Stephanie - who remarried Serge - discovered the letter from Paulina in which she explained where was the box of clover leaves left behind by Roy. So, evidently, Beatrice wonders if Linda knows about the accident. @ You get all that?
Wake up, I've just found the escapee!
Thief! @ @ Leave my money box alone!
Sorry dear customer, but all that interests me is my modest concern.
Fool, don't do that! ANYTHING can happen now!

Ha, ha! You too are looking for his treasure? Well, I sure once had an old dusty book about LeBorgne, but a customer bought it this morning. It was a rabbibunny. I know that he works over at the library.

I have not seen this young lady. But go over to the Astronomer's house. Even though he is not allowed to leave his own house, he knows everything. He lives in the last house on the hill overlooking the city.
It tastes EXACTLY the same as before. I won't guide you through the library.
Did you know that a wise guy dumped some syrup into the island's water supply? I'd like to find that guy so that I can give him a piece of my mind. You wouldn't happen to know him, would you?
It was me! Not bad, huh?
Probably another FunFrock stunt.

Bravo! This little twinge of cherry is fantastic. Ever since my doctor told me that I could only drink tap water and... well you know all that. In gratitude, I can show you all the ancient works that are here, even the LEGENDARY ones!
Oh, so Dr. FunFrock is taking care of us now. Funny, I find it hard to believe that it was him.
I have not seen this person.

My dear sir, I have been looking for Captain LeBorgne's log for years now. And would you believe that I found it today while shopping in the Old Burg? Naturally, such a piece should be consulted on site. Go look on the table in the back of the room next to the projection room.
Wait here, I'll go get them for you.
We must have something about LeBorgne. Go check with the chief librarian. You know him already, he's a rather large, orange rabbibunny.
Ok, I'll read you an extract from this book if you promise to leave me alone. What do you want me to read about?
Pirate recipes.
Leborgne's treasure.
Why LeBorgne?
As you know, this is a French game, and our respect for the culinary arts prevents us from revealing the ingredients used in pirate recipes. 

To find Captain LeBorgne's treasure, the voyager who arrives at the port of Proxima island must use the closest mooring post as a guide. With his back to the docked boats, he must follow these instructions in DISCREET mode: @ 6 steps to the North (straight ahead), then 6 steps to the East (to his right), following the gradual slope. 2 steps to the North (straight ahead) until he reaches the metal garbage can, 3 steps to the East (to his right) until he arrives at a light post. He must stand EXACTLY between the 2 lamp posts, and then take 8 steps to the North until he arrives at a gate. Captain LeBorgne's treasure is in the building behind the gate."
That was his nickname because he was always chewing an old toothpick. One day, during a typhoon, he sneezed: he found his toothpick, but lost an eye!
There's no need to be aggressive, I was here before you!
Good day!
I don't know where they could be.
This is rebellion, it is forbidden to speak of that Legend!
I didn't see her, but the Astronomer will certainly be able to help you.
You should talk to the sailors about that kind of story.
I'd like to help you, but I don't know where they are.
Hmmh! Quite a character that LeBorgne, he scoured the entire hemisphere a few hundred years ago. My fisherman friend told me that the Bazaar is selling an object that belonged to LeBorgne.
I don't know where they are.
Hiiii hi ! Bbbrrfff !
One of my colleagues was galloping at full speed across the White Leaf Desert and he said that he saw someone locked up in a grotto, behind a giant symbol of some kind.
Never heard anything about it!
What's a Teleportation Center?
Hi!
Ah! That LeBorgne was quite a man!
Ha ha, that's a good one! Sorry I don't have any with me.
Can't seem to sell a single hair dryer here. One of my colleagues is already out there trying his best. If this keeps up, I'll have to move on to another island.
I don't know where they are.
I cannot help you, my friend. Don't know what you are talking about.
Take that, rebel!
Move along!
Good day
Go to the tavern, they love pirate stories there!
Leave me alone, I have nothing to say.
Good day
It is strictly forbidden to talk about that!
Never heard anything about it.
I don't know where they are.
Sorry, I don't know what you're talking about.
Hi!
Calm down!
I didn't see her.
Look, you seem like a nice guy, but you're a big boy now. Figure it out for yourself, I'm not a library!
I don't know anything about all that.
I didn't see her.
I don't know where they could be.
Pirates, phooey! Those sailors will say anything to get someone to buy them a drink!
Good day
30 Kashes for a hair dryer, how about that? I normally sell them door to door, but customers are sparse, and you seem nice enough.
Come in!
Good day, my good sir.
No. Not at all.
Go see Beatrice and tell her that Julia sent you. She'll explain all that better than I can. She lives on the outskirts of the Old Burg, in a house next to the sea, on Peg Leg Street.
Julia spoke a lot about you.
I don't know anything about pirating, try talking to the sailors instead.
I don't know where they are, kind sir.
Good day, young quetch.
I didn't see her.
I don't know what you're talking about!
They say that the tap water tastes better now. Great! Another publicity stunt from the anti-alcohol foundation.
I never saw 'em
I don't know her, but go see Wadbull over at the bazaar. And be careful... normally it is forbidden to talk about that!
Ah, I never heard that one. But the one about the pirate that had rheumatisms in one leg and termites in the other cracks me up every time!
Hi mate!
I don't know where they are.
LeBorgne! Since he didn't know how to read, he had his cook write the Captain's log. I know that it is for sale at the bazaar next door.
Sorry, I don't know anything about that.
This super Holomap costs only 20 Kashes (you will find that it is very useful!).
Gas for 10 voyages costs 30 Kashes.
15 hearts of life powder will cost you 30 Kashes.
10 flasks of magic powder will cost you 30 Kashes.
A meca-penguin will cost you 3 Kashes.
I didn't see her.
Sorry, I never heard anything about that.
Hi friend.
I don't know where they are.
Good day
Ask the boss or the sailor at the table.
You know that it is forbidden to talk about that! But this is your lucky day: I'd most happily turn you in, but that would deprive me of a chance to line my pockets with your Kashes.
Good day
I'm a huge STAR WARSÂ™ fan. The saga's sequel should be released soon, so I already reserved my seat in the movie theater!
I'd like to help you, but I really don't know much, except about movies. Good luck!
I found this page ripped out of a book. It says "... pull the middle lever ONCE, then pull the right lever ONCE." This must be the answer to some kind of puzzle!
I don't know where they are. Sorry.
Good day
Ask the rabbibunny with the yellow T-shirt, he's the librarian.
Ow! But I found this page on the ground, I didn't rip it out. I promise!

According to the book I have, there is a "Clear water" lake in the Hamalayi mountains, somewhere to the North West of Principal Island. Did you know that the Hamalayi range is impossible to cross? It marks the border with the Northern hemisphere, the one that Dr. FunFrock cleared out. The sun is too hot for us over there: the temperature is unbearable, and the changes in climate caused the development of mutant monsters. And despite the fact that the good doctor spared us from all that, there are still rebels out there who want to overthrow him - it's shameful!
Sorry, I don't know what you're talking about.
Ask the librarian, he knows a lot about the history of LeBorgne.

Did you know that Dr. FunFrock installed busts of his effigy to protect us? The ones that don't have a pedestal are placed on ancient seals. Since these symbols were indestructible, at least the busts hide them now!
I don't know where they are.
Go see the librarian.
I never saw him, but try a little further up at the Bazaar. Wadbull knows a lot and he SELLS A BIT OF EVERYTHING!
Nobody remembers that nowadays. I even wonder if the library still has books about the Legend.
I don't know her. Sorry.
I don't know anything about it, but some people say that there used to be some books over at the library that spoke of it.
Stop doing that, you're going to put ashes everywhere!
Don't know where they are, but forget about it! Teleportation makes me sick.
Ewwwww! Teleportation makes me nauseous.
No more gas.
By the way - thanks, I have the red card!
You can't imagine what it's like to be locked up! @ It's awful... just awful!
I doubt that she is being held here.
Never heard anything about it.
They say that he was never captured!
Sorry, but I really don't know anything about it.
Drinking water for Principal Island: DO NOT THROW ANYTHING IN THE TANK!
Sorry dear customer, but this is a bazaar here, not a library!
No one remembers that stuff today, that's just a lot of bunk.
Well ... I don't know, but someone in the Old Burg must know something about this stupid Legend.
She's not being held here. But if you want my red card, go and see my brother. Our house's location is marked on your holomap.
I was just thinking as well, that I've seen this quetch somewhere before!
Go try at the Old Burg tavern, and talk to the bar tender.
Hi, I've just returned from a trip around this hemisphere and I'm selling my boat. Follow me if you're interested.
Good day, so you've been around the hemisphere? Watch out for the icebergs near the Hamalayi mountains!
You might get into trouble with the authorities if you carry this flag. It's a rebel's emblem.
Come here! Now that's a real sailor! LeBorgne had a log that must have contained the location of his treasure somewhere.
Never seen 'em, don't even know what you're talking about.
Well, well, what do we have here? A snooper? Twinsen I presume. I would like to know what you're doing here.
There's a treasure on this island: you must blow into a magic horn in front of FunFrock's bust to gain access to it.
I am not familiar with that story.
